text: Use user provided python code during runtime
I'm developing a system that operates on (arbitrary) data from databases.
The data may need some preprocessing before the system can work with it.
To allow the user the specify possibly complex rules I though of giving the user the possibility to input Python code which is used to do this task.
My plan is to introduce the tables and columns as variables and let the user to anything Python can do (including access to the standard libs).
How do I take a string (the user entered), compile it to Python (after adding code to provide the input data) and get the output.
I think the easiest way would be to use the user-entered data a the body of a method and take the return value of that function a my new data.
It's unimportant that the user may enter malicious code since the worst thing that could happen is, that he screws up his own system, which is thankfully not my problem ;)
